- **Compilation target documentation** added covering all OCaml compilation modes: [native code](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (ocamlopt for high-performance production executables), [bytecode](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (ocamlc for fast development iteration), [JavaScript targets](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (Js_of_ocaml and Melange for web applications), [WebAssembly targets](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (wasm_of_ocaml and experimental Wasocaml), and [unikernels](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (MirageOS with Solo5, Unikraft, and Xen backends) with platform support details, use case guidance, and community resources ([#3378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3378))

summaries.activity_summary: Repository maintenance focused on documentation updates and release announcements with 10 commits
summaries.activity:
- **Windows installation documentation** received a complete rewrite by contributors to modernize the installation process, replacing deprecated tools with current opam 2.2+ recommendations and adding comprehensive setup instructions for Windows users
- **Changelog infrastructure** improvements with enhanced guidelines for contributors and clarification of the changelog's purpose as a user-oriented blog rather than traditional changelog
- **Release coordination** activities with multiple changelog entries for OCaml 5.2.1-rc1, OCaml 5.3.0-beta1, opam 2.3.0~rc1, and Dune 3.16.1 releases
- **Content aggregation** through automated OCaml Planet blog post integration bringing fresh community content to the website

summaries.brief_summary: Build system improvements with Dune template preprocessing and three community issues including package count discrepancies
summaries.new_features_summary: Dune dialect for EML template preprocessing streamlines build process by replacing 100+ manual compilation rules
summaries.new_features:
- **Dune template preprocessing** dialect implementation streamlines build system by automatically handling EML template compilation, replacing 396 lines of manual rules with a single dialect declaration in `dune-project` ([719c3a3b593ff013f5b0dfb2d421d181d44dd5d2](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/719c3a3b593ff013f5b0dfb2d421d181d44dd5d2))
- **OCaml Planet content updates** with automated blog post scraping delivering five new articles from Robur and Tarides, plus OCaml Weekly News coverage ([#2790](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2790), [#2787](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2787), [#2785](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2785))
summaries.activity_summary: Three community-reported issues addressed website functionality including package statistics accuracy and blog scraping reliability
summaries.activity:
- **Package statistics discrepancy** reported by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) showing "new packages this month" displaying 42 packages when actual count should be 197+ new packages in October ([#2791](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2791))
- **Planet feed scraper** inquiry from [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) regarding missing blog post from Robur, which was subsequently resolved when scraper automatically updated content ([#2784](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2784))
- **Cookbook testing automation** proposal by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) requesting GitHub Action to regularly validate cookbook examples work with updated package versions ([#2786](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2786))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on automation and reliability with build system improvements and quality assurance proposals for educational content
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Build system modernization** through Dune dialect adoption eliminates maintenance overhead for template processing and establishes more maintainable development workflow
- **Content quality assurance** emphasis with proposals for automated testing of educational materials to ensure examples remain functional with package updates
- **Community-driven issue reporting** identifying website accuracy problems and infrastructure reliability concerns, demonstrating active user engagement with website functionality
